name: The Palms Resort

reviews.text: But is it the best place to stay on SPI? That will probably depend on the person and the nature of your visit. Read on. There is a lot to like about this motel. The rooms are well appointed with a wall mounted flat screen TV, two areas separated by a wall with a small kitchen/sitting area with a fridge, sink and microwave, and a bedroom area with a bathroom and shower in the remainder of the room.
reviews.title: A nice, well maintained, well appointed motel in an excellent location.

likes.liked: — Well maintained, clean, nicely decorated rooms. Staff are very attentive and helpful.
likes.disliked: — Not best suited for long term or busines travelers. Wireless internet was weak at times.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and well maintained although I found a pair of panties just under the bed that I carefully disposed of in the trash with my toes.
reviews.title: Very Pleased!

likes.liked: — quiet and peaceful, easy beach access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is nice although the menu is a bit on the pricey side. They serve breakfast lunch and dinner and the food is good. But $4.75 for a 12 ounce Dos Equis? Come on guys.
reviews.title: Simply the Best

likes.disliked: — small pool area, but we didn't ever use it!

reviews.text: The front desk staff were very helpful and accommodating.
reviews.title: Palms Resort went above and beyond my expectations!

reviews.text: I travel a good deal and spend a lot of time in hotel rooms. This chain is suited for for short visits with family or a girl friend getaway. The room is not well suited for the business traveler. As the rooms do not come with a small desk, blow dryer, iron or board. Although I was told I could get some of those at the front desk but who wants to lug that stuff up and down stairs? The rooms weren't really designed for long term but still they are nice and for the most part clean. The wireless internet service was spotty at times in my room. I had to move
reviews.title: Great place

likes.disliked: — space for a family of four

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We originally were looking for a Condo on the beach for our stay in South Padre for New Years Eve.While searching on the net I came across a review for The Palms Resort. We were looking at $100 to $150 per night for a Condo on the beach. The online price for a room at the Palms was $45.00 per night off season. I called the hotel to book a room and was told the rate would be $65.00 per night. I told them I was online and the rate was $45.00. She said they were getting booked full and if I booked online I may not get a room. I hung up the phone and booked the room immediately. (I had read online that when you call to book the rates are higher)
reviews.title: Nice Rooms with Great Prices

likes.liked: — Rooms with a beach view and close beach access
likes.disliked: — Parking Lot was small and difficult to turn around

reviews.text: That evening. We had a room confirmation emailed to us early the next morning with the online $45.00 per night rate.
reviews.title: What A Great Place!!!!!

likes.liked: — Location, Location, Location........Wonderful people running this place......
likes.disliked: — That we eventually had to leave.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel/motel/resort is only 2 stories tall and although the outside is clean and well maintained it is an older building
reviews.title: NIce spot
BEWARE The Palms Resort Motel
reviews.text: and may not look that great to some. We are use to staying

reviews.title: The Cafe is perfect
reviews.text: in Eureka Springs in Arkansas and the little cabins/motel/hotel rooms look like this so we knew the interior was more important

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was nervous about booking this place since I had never been to South Padre and didn't know what to expect. The island is one long strip of condos, and The Palms Resort is hidden among them. What a relief to come to this small, well maintained hotel. It was very basic, which is what we expected for the price, but clean and cared for. The cafe on the beach was a major attraction for us, and the food was as good, if not better than most places on the island.. (nothing is worth writing home). We felt lucky to stay at this location and were very pleased with the friendly service of the hotel staff.
reviews.title: Preserved Motel on the strip

reviews.text: If you don't eat at the Cafe at the Palms, venture off the island to dine. There are much better choices in Port Isabel, like Joe's Seafood (it looks like a dive, but the oysters on the half shell can't be beat at $6.50/doz) and The Lost Galleon for the best "fry" around.
reviews.title: Definitely Worth the Price

likes.liked: — Great beach access, nice kitchenette, clean room, nice pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Palms during the off-season: between spring break and summer. It was a steal at $80 per night for the king suite. The room looked exactly like the photos on the hotel Web site; it was very clean; the AC worked great; and the little kitchenette was helpful for our family of four (two kids under the age of 5). The pool was even nicer than the photos, and the beach access made this place really worth it.
reviews.title: Nice but Didn't Live up to its Potential

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend The Palms, with four caveats:
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: (1) The rooms are pretty small. It worked for us since our kids are so small, but families with older kids would feel pretty cramped, I think. The bathroom is tiny, and there's only a shower, no tub. Not tons of hot water, either, but enough for all of us to take warm showers each day after the beach.
reviews.title: The Palms Resort keeps getting better and better!

likes.liked: — Right on the beach and great services at the hotel (internet, bar, pool, restaurant)

reviews.title: Won't go again. Not suited for families.
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. 2 adults and 4 kids. Kids ages 5-10. One evening we receive a knock on the door from a lady who peers in the room and asks if we have 4 kids. I say yes and she says that the hotel doesn't allow more than 2 kids and that they will charge 30 dollars extra per child. Now, this lady had no uniform or shirt with the hotel logo, I thought she was just some visitor as well, but she might have worked there. Any ways, her visit wasn't too pleasant.

reviews.title: Loved it!!
reviews.text: The next day at check out, i get my bill and see the charge for 65 dollars each night. I question it and they said that only 2 children are permitted, because of noise and mess that they make. She then mentioned that they usually ask people to leave immediately when there are more than 4 kids in the room. I guess to make me feel lucky to not have to live in the streets. I couldn't very well get a 2nd room and put 2 of our kids in it by themselves. I tell them that it is not a very family friendly hotel, and they say yes, just not to families over 4 people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love'd it! Me and my husband had a weekend getaway here and the resort was awesome! The staff was very friendly and helpfull... When we got there we checked and in and got our keys to the room! I walk in and it was more than I expected. Nice little living area with a couch , table and a little kitchen with a fridge no stove! The bed was okay the floor was tile so it has no mildew smell! The complimetary shampoo and cond and soap are from bath and body works. It is right next to the beach and the cafe was great!!! Very peacefull!! Ill recommend it to my family and friends! And if i go back to South Padre I will definatly stay here again!!
reviews.title: Would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was better than expected. We were surprised by the large size of the room. As promised, the location is right on the beach, and that section of the beach wasn't crowded when we were there. The restaurant/bar is great. Check-in/Check-out was easy. We had a late check-in and it went smoothly. They also gave us an extra hour to check-out on Sunday so we could extend the surf time a little longer. The only downside to this place was the airconditioner in the room. It kept the living area very cool, but the bedroom section didn't get as cool because there is a dividing wall. A ceiling fan helped, but the difference in temp was noticable. Front office staff was friendly and helpful and the housekeeper was EXCELLENT. Take beach towels with you or be prepared to buy some as souvenirs because the hotel didn't offer any. Summary: We had a relaxing beach weekend here, and we would stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Quaint and Quiet by the Sea

likes.liked: — The price paired with the location

reviews.text: We looked at the Palms on the beach based almost exclusively on the TripAdvisor ranking and reviews. What a great place! If you are looking for a top of the line resort, then this definitely isn't for you. If you are looking for a reasonably priced, very clean place to stay, then look no further,
reviews.title: Paradise at The Palms

likes.liked: — it was small, on the beach and reasonably priced
likes.disliked: — initially there was no stopper for the bathtub and the sheets for the fold out bed didn't fit the bed.

aka: The Palms Hotel South Padre Island
description: Ideally located on the white sand beaches of South Padre Island, The Palms Resort is a relaxing oasis boasting beach front access, stylish, comfortable accommodations, and friendly, attentive service. Our resort offers guests the personal service of an intimate boutique hotel with the modern amenities of larger business hotels. Our award winning beachside retaurant (The Cafe on the Beach) is open daily for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Start your day with Eggs Benedict and a mimosa. End your day with steak and lobster and a fine wine. Enjoy mojitos poolside from our full service bar!
